scoring_rule: Each problem: ALL words must be correct. Level: 80% of problems must pass.

problems.prompt:
# Syllable Puzzle

Find 8 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
acids, pitch, ri, tons, ing, scam, in, leash, edge, fairest, pho, or, te, mers

## Clues
A. (1 syllables) — A set of three animals (especially greyhounds, foxes, bucks, and hares;)
B. (2 syllables) — a quantum of electromagnetic radiation; an elementary particle that is its own antiparticle
C. (1 syllables) — street name for lysergic acid diethylamide
D. (1 syllables) — Structure hint: (suffix: -est) — lacking exceptional quality or ability
E. (4 syllables) — Structure hint: (prefix: inter-) — The set of all [masked] points of a set.
F. (1 syllables) — To form a border to; to enclose, to border.
G. (2 syllables) — Structure hint: (suffix: -ing) — hit (a golf ball) in a high arc with a backspin
H. (2 syllables) — a person who swindles you by means of deception or fraud

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.

## Clues

E. (3 syllables) — SYN: looker

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.

Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.
